title.narrative: Marketing Innovations for Sustainable Health Development

description.narrative: (Bangladesh): The Marketing Innovations for Sustainable Health Development activity implemented by the Social Marketing Company (SMC) of Bangladesh will work to meet market demand for family planning and other public health products and services through the distribution networks that it has developed. .With FY 2020 funds, SMC will consolidate all its previous activities and finalize its strategic business plan towards growth and financial sustainability. The activity will expand its network of sales agents, distributors, and service delivery outlets, and introduce new health products into the market. To achieve a successful roll-out, the activity will recruit, train, and supply the complementary networks of private physicians (Pink Star Providers), pharmacies and small outlets (Blue Star Providers), and rural female entrepreneur community sales agents (Gold Star Members). The network members will be trained and equipped to provide a combination of public health services, such as children growth monitoring, nutritional counseling, delaying early marriage and first pregnancy, identifying and referring gender-based violence (GBV) survivors to GBV care centers. The network providers will sell SMC-branded basic medicines, contraceptives, oral rehydration salts, safe delivery kits,, and menstrual hygiene products. Additionally the network providers will provide nutrition counseling and growth monitoring and promotion (GMP) services and offer SMC branded micronutrients products for children under five. .The activity is designed to assist the Government of Bangladesh to achieve its public health goals and enable Bangladeshis to achieve desired family size and maintain their family's health. This activity will support the U.S. National Security Strategy Pillar IV, the State-USAID Joint Strategic Plan Goal Two, and the U.S. government's mission objective of improved health status in Bangladesh..
